verses.verse: To the chief Musician <WH5329> on Neginoth <WH5058>, Maschil <WH4905>, A Psalm of David <WH1732>, when the Ziphims <WH2130> came <WH935> and said <WH559> to Saul <WH7586>, Doth not David <WH1732> hide <WH5641> himself with us? Save <WH3467> me, O God <WH430>, by thy name <WH8034>, and judge <WH1777> me by thy strength <WH1369>.
Hear <WH8085> my prayer <WH8605>, O God <WH430>; give ear <WH238> to the words <WH561> of my mouth <WH6310>.
For strangers <WH2114> are risen up <WH6965> against me, and oppressors <WH6184> seek <WH1245> after my soul <WH5315>: they have not set <WH7760> God <WH430> before them. Selah <WH5542>.
Behold, God <WH430> is mine helper <WH5826>: the Lord <WH136> is with them that uphold <WH5564> my soul <WH5315>.
He shall reward <WH7725> <WH7725> evil <WH7451> unto mine enemies <WH8324>: cut them off <WH6789> in thy truth <WH571>.
I will freely <WH5071> sacrifice <WH2076> unto thee: I will praise <WH3034> thy name <WH8034>, O LORD <WH3068>; for it is good <WH2896>.
For he hath delivered <WH5337> me out of all trouble <WH6869>: and mine eye <WH5869> hath seen <WH7200> his desire upon mine enemies <WH341>.
